item.title: Modifying the firmware with OpenWrt
item.description:
Introduction link

As you know, some time ago, I tried to install OpenWrt on a Fonera+ (the larger one with two Ethernet connectors). After persisting, I finally managed to get something partially functional: recompiling the Fon firmware and getting both Ethernet ports working. However, WiFi still remains a problem.

After a period of working on my Frankenstein-modified Foneras, I decided to try again with another approach: using the Fon binary firmware and activating a serial console. The first step was to get a binary update for the Fonera+ in the form of the file foneraplus_1.1.1.1.fon.

item.title: Enabling SSH on the Fonera+
item.description:
Introduction link

The Fonera is a small device based on OpenWRT that allows you to distribute WiFi (HotSpot). To learn more, I invite you to visit the official website. In short, it is possible to play a bit more with the basic functions, which is why I tackled SSH access on this device.

Important: Any firmware modification can take 10 minutes to update. So don’t reboot before that!

Prerequisites link

  • A web server

Apache will do fine… (on Mac: /Library/WebServer/Documents)
